SENT.plain: The comparative research of effect of Pinealon and Cortexin on behavior and activity of caspase-3 in a brain of old rats in a model of carotid arteries occlusion was conducted
It is shown that introduction of short peptides promotes a survival rate of the animals that have modeled occlusion of carotid arteries
Under Pinealon before occlusion of carotid arteries, behavioral dream has been increased and a position-finding behavior, a motivational behavior and a motor performance have been reduced
The rats that were introduced Cortexin before carotid arteries occlusion demonstrated the raise of behavioral dream time
At introduction of Pinealon activity of caspase-3 moderately raises in false-operated animals and in a model of occlusion of carotid arteries
